First off, let me say that I have a fairly significant amount of hours in this game considering I am giving it a negative review. The fact is that most of the time I have played has been with friends, and even if you are doing something you don't like you'll still have fun because you're doing it with your friends. Now that's out of the way, I'm going to continue with the review:

I've played a few asymmetrical games, and I think the thing that defines how the game plays more than anything else is how much power is given to the side that has multiple players. That sets the bar for what general power level the game should have. In some games the "survivors" are supposed to be very weak, and in others they are flying around the map with jetpacks and machine guns. The single player side has to be designed with a matching level of power and that sets the tone of the game.

My issue with this game is that the developers appeared to originally be going for a very low powered game, but they didn't really seem to be all that good at their jobs. The initial concept was pretty much just a game of hide and seek, where the survivors tried to do their objectives and hide while the "killer" (single player side) looked around to find them and do slasher movie things to them. That was the concept, unfortunately the developers actually ended up creating an environment where the killer could easily get clowned on by survivors who knew what they were doing. To their credit they have balanced the game a lot better since the initial release, but by doing so I think they have lost the core of what the game was supposed to be about.

The developers have introduced a lot of options with a very high power level, for both sides, that distorts the game and pulls it away from the originally intended low power level vision they had. This results in a very un-fun experience because both sides have some tools that are the equivalent of bringing a tactical nuke to a knife fight. To their credit the developers have generally tried to fix the worst of these, but when they do a lot of their changes tend to reveal they don't actually know how their own game works and how it is played at a high level, so they generally create almost as many problems as they solve.

The root problem is that the base gameplay loop is incredibly simple. Survivors have to power 5 generators across the map, which requires sitting in front of them holding the mouse button for 90 seconds while occasional reaction test quicktime events pop up. After that they move to an exit gate and open it, again by standing in front of it and holding the mouse button (no reaction tests this time). The killer is trying to find the survivors and hit them so they fall down, then pick them up and put them on a sacrifice point called a hook, which requires the survivor to sit there as their death timer ticks down doing (what else) reaction test minigames until another survivor comes along and rescues them. This is a very basic shallow gameplay loop, and it works for the original low power level game the developers had in mind, but it doesn't really provide a lot of levers to adjust balance once you see that things are not working.

This really comes down to proactive vs reactive balancing. The entire history of this game seems to be that of reactive balancing, where the developers don't understand their game well enough to make the right balance fixes, so they are caught in an eternal cycle of nerfing the latest tactical nuke that makes all the players angry, rather than having a proactive plan for how they want their game to play and making changes that push the game in that direction. A side effect of this inconsistent balancing seems to be an incredibly bitter toxic community with an "us vs them" mentality. Sadly this is pretty common to asymmetrical games, because people don't seem to realize that both sides have to be balanced and fun to play or else the game will die.

The last thing I will leave you with is that I don't think this will ever get better. The developers have gone on record saying that they have no intentions of slowing down and doing a pure balance pass because they know they have to keep pumping new content into the game every few months (content that is usually licensed and purchasable with real life money). What's left is a game that doesn't know what it wants to be designed by developers who don't know how their game works, and with a community that seems to be more interested in either blaming the other side for being OP or telling the other side to get good than actually trying to figure out how to salvage this dumpster fire.

The only reason I can see for this game to have gotten so popular is that it happened to be in the right place at the right time and managed to land some licensing rights for classic horror movie characters. I would highly advise anybody looking at this to find another game that is made better rather than spending your time with this one.

When i'm survivor match ups are good(mixed), when im killer im going against the same 4 stack builds. 6-8 months ago even with boons it was fine but now its just unplayable.

Even after the major update I find this game unplayable. The survivor half is winnable with a 4stack or maybe a killer than doesnt know what they are doing. As killer "I sleep" because I can win doing that now. Clearly an over correction and i'm done in being invested in any game behavior puts out. They managed to essentially ruin everything that made it fun.

ive played dead by daylight for about a year now, and i have to say its one of the most unique and fun games ive ever played. sure, it has its flaws. but with time and practice these flaws can be easily avoided- such as being tunneled; running various perks and out-running the killer with loops can prevent that. 

i also feel that the new upcoming mid-chapter rework will definitely change how the game is played, and i honestly am a fan of the changes being made. though, some perks- such as "off the record"- are pretty busted with the new reworks, this will definitely change the current meta of running the same 4 perks constantly.

overall, this game is great fun, even though it can be annoying at times.

The game mechanics and overall idea of the game are great, but way too many killers just camp and tunnel and generally act like total fuckwads. While it makes sense that the game favors the killer somewhat, a 16 to 1 kill to escape ratio is apparently not enough, the devs want to make it even harder for survivors, and easier for assholes who play to make the game irritating rather than fun. When you get a good, fair killer, it can be enjoyable, but that is not the majority of the time.

Update:
Still more of the same. I continue playing with friends, because at least that can be fun. But you have way too many people who cheat, dont follow the spirit of the game, and are just pricks. And unfortunately it seems the devs dont care.

I enjoy playing, but, there are some things you deal with in game that could cause you to not like it. They happen to me all the time.. I have also noticed them when watching different people stream on discord/twitch also... so I am assuming many people deal with the same issues.

 A few examples; 
* You could be running from the keebler and be a decent length away - yet somehow get hit. 
*Hitting the space bar to vault a pallet or a window is a 50/50 lately as sometimes it doesn't work properly and/or has a major delay where you " freeze " mid air after you hit space. 
* Hitting the space bar to pull a pallet is also a 50/50 chance, the 50% that it wont pull the pallet you're stuck right next to the pallet and get knocked by the keebler. 
* When another person DCs - SOMETIMES - it will count against the other players of the game that did not DC and cause a temporary play ban.
* Randomly getting stuck on things you shouldn't get stuck on such as rocks/trees and things like that.

The body blocking is frustrating - along with the constant camping but the camping isn't as bad if you have a decent team, without a decent team the game will end FAST. Haha. Overall I think the game is fun, and challenging at times!!

It also comes with a custom game mode that i haven't tried yet but i believe you and your own friends can play together in a local lobby with 1 being the killer and the rest are survivors. the best thing about it is that the game has many killers famous from their franchises, such as Freddy Kucger, Michael Myers, the ring girl from the movie "The Ring", Pinhead, Pyramid Head, Jigsaw, and so on.

There is a meta rework coming, but in the current meta the game is only worth playing if you play Survivor.  For the other 20% of the playerbase who main Killer - wihout whom matches aren't possible - Dead By Daylight is an exercise in constant frustration.  In addition to the numerous "Get Out of Jail Free" cards provided by various perks by design, there are also a great number of ways Survivors can abuse various intrinsic game mechanics to gain advantages that are not explicitly by design, the cumulative effect of which is that against experienced Survivor players, the Killer feels less like the "cat" in this game of "Cat and Mouse", and more like the mouse.

TL;DR, if you like easy objective-based gameplay without much challenge, play Survivor.  If you have a fetish for being bullied, play Killer.  If neither of these interest you, give this one a pass unless it's on sale.

The game doesn't look bad but it doesn't really look good either I don't know how to explain it. 

Other than those and couple other issues I can't bother mentioning, I have had some fun times with this game. And its pretty addicting too. Overall it's alright once you get passed the annoying shit.

-The code in the game is so buggy they break something every update and they could of not even touched it. If you wish to get hit threw windows because the server that you playing on shows different things for both killer and survivor. Enjoy sitting there while your downed wondering how a hatchet hit you wile you are behind a wall.

-It pulls you in by "looking fun" and then when you waste time and money in the game. You don't wanna stop playing because you put to much effort in the game. 

-Plus the community is mostly filled with toxic dickheads who wants to do nothing but ruin your experience with killer/survivor. Don't fall in the rabbit hole like I have don't play this game.
